title: Area of the region bounded by two functions

content.question: What is the area of the region enclosed by the graphs of <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mi>x</mi> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </math>, <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </math>, and <math> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math> ?

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Use appropriate mathematical symbols and notation (e.g., Represent a derivative using ƒ'(x), y', and dy/dx).
